intro: Elatostema pellionianum var. effusuma, commonly known as the velvetleaf sorrel, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a soft texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. Elatostema pellionianum var. effusuma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
